newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton close steady, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton close steady, seen stable.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates closed unchanged on Wednesday as selling pressure from ginners eased, dealers at the private Karachi Cotton Association (KCA) said.

Ginners, who were holding some 1.6 million 375-lb bales from the 1996/97 (July-June) crop on hopes of higher prices, had slowed down selling, dealer Abdul Qadir said. "Rates are likely to open stable on Thursday," he said.
In the kerb market, NIAB-78 was quoted at 2,200/2,325 rupees per maund (37.32 kg), K-68 at 2,475/2,500 and MNH-93 at 2,475/2,525, the dealer said.
